Dataset_Info.Funding_Info: NOAA Climate Program Office; NOAA Ocean Acidification Program

Variable.Description_of_Variable: Mole fraction of CO2 in the equilibrator headspace (dry) at equilibrator temperature (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 measured in dry outside air (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 in outside air associated with each water analysis. These values are interpolated between the bracketing averaged good xCO2_ATM analyses (ppm)
Barometric pressure in the equilibrator headspace (hPa)
Barometric pressure measured outside, corrected to sea level (hPa)
Sea surface salinity on Practical Salinity Scale (o/oo)
Fugacity of CO2 in sea water at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Fugacity of CO2 in air corresponding to the interpolated xCO2 at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Sea water fCO2 minus interpolated air fCO2 (μatm)
Quality control flag for fCO2 values (2=good, 3=questionable)
Quality control subflag for fCO2 values, provides explanation when QC flag=3

Equilibrator_Design.Equilibrator_Type: Spray head above dynamic pool, no thermal jacket
Equilibrator_Design.Drying_Method_for_CO2_in_water: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).
Equilibrator_Design.Additional_Information: Primary equilibrator is vented through a secondary equilibrator. The system is a CCN-Gen2 system.

CO2_in_Marine_Air.Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 2.1 hours
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Location_and_Height: On mast above the bridge at ~13 meters above the sea surface
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Drying_Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).

CO2_Sensor.Manufacturer_of_Calibration_Gas: Std 1: CA01433, 293.79 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~2.1 hours. Std 2: CA05098, 358.98 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~2.1 hours. Std 3: CC71655, 423.51 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~2.1 hours. Std 4: CC106643, 519.15 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~2.1 hours.
CO2_Sensor.CO2_Sensor_Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every ~2.1 hours using field standards that were calibrated with primary standards at AOML that are directly traceable to the WMO scale (CO2_X2019).
CO2_Sensor.Environmental_Control: Instrument is located in the air-conditioned dry lab
CO2_Sensor.Method_References: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.

Sea_Surface_Temperature.Location: After sea water pump in the forward, port hull
Sea_Surface_Temperature.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by ship.

Equilibrator_Temperature.Location: Inserted into equilibrator ~5 cm below water level

Equilibrator_Pressure.Location: Attached to equilibrator headspace. Differential pressure reading from Setra 239 attached to the equilibrator headspace is added to the pressure reading from the LI-COR.
Equilibrator_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

Atmospheric_Pressure.Location: In deck box above winch control shack, ~10 m above sea surface.
Atmospheric_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

Sea_Surface_Salinity.Location: In the dry lab along with pCO2 system
Sea_Surface_Salinity.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision. Maintained by the ship.

x_tags.Additional_Information: The analytical system operated well during the cruise. The seawater system was secured for an operational stop in Jacksonville, FL. Original Data Location: http://www.aoml.noaa.gov/ocd/ocdweb/occ.html under "Completed Collections" Full unprocessed data files from analytical instrument including flow information plus meteorological and TSG data at time of sampling can be obtained upon request.
